name: Jacobian conjecture
rephrased: If a polynomial map from an n-dimensional space to itself has a constant non-zero Jacobian determinant, then it has a polynomial inverse.
implication_form: If a polynomial map has a constant non-zero Jacobian determinant, then it has a polynomial inverse.
explained: The Jacobian conjecture states that if a polynomial function from an n-dimensional complex affine space to itself has a constant non-zero Jacobian determinant, then it is invertible, and its inverse is also a polynomial function.
